# Advance Procurement Notice: Base Program Montreal Garrison (QC)

## Brief Description

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is issuing an Advance Procurement Notice (APN) for a base program at the Montreal Garrison (QC). This notification is not a bid solicitation but rather an opportunity for consultants or contractors to initiate the sponsorship request process for potentially obtaining required security clearances.

## Description of Services

The anticipated contracts may include:

* Support studies
* Design and construction of new infrastructure, renovation, and demolition of Department of National Defence (DND) infrastructures
* Inspection, testing, and maintenance services of DND infrastructures

## Anticipated Contracts

The following solicitations are anticipated to proceed as noted in the table below, subject to approval from DND:

| Contract No. | Title | Approximate Estimate | Anticipated Posting Date |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| MLAB2223 | Standing Offer Agreement - Laboratory | $500,000 | December 2023 |
| MLHT2324 | Inspection and Maintenance of High-Voltage Electrical Distribution Network | $600,000 | January 2024 |
| MLEG2324 | Standing Offer Agreement - General Contractor | $400,000 | February 2024 |
| MLARCH24 | Standing Offer Agreement - Architecture | $2,000,000 | February 2024 |

## Security Requirements

To be eligible for contract award, a consultant or contractor must:

* Hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of closing
* Submit a sponsorship request application to DCC through the Industrial Security Program (ISP)

## Process for Obtaining Security Clearance

DCC offers preliminary assistance with the sponsorship request process. The process involves submitting a sponsorship request package to DCC, which is then forwarded to the Contract Security Program (CSP) 30 days prior to the anticipated solicitation closing for Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and 60 days prior for Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET.
